title.narrative: NUTRITION OP 3 - ENHANCED DEMAND AND BEHAVIOUR ADOPTION

description.narrative: By 2023, under-five children, adolescents and pregnant women adopt optimal nutrition and caring practices at individual, household and community levels, including in times of emergency., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination and resource leveraging of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at scale

sector.narrative: Diet diversity in early childhood, including complementary feeding, multiple micronutrient powders and lipid-based nutrition supplements
Maternal nutrition, including counselling, micronutrient supplementation and dietary support
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting and wasting (excludes intervention specific strategies)
Prevention of undernutrition and micronutrient deficiencies in middle childhood and adolescence
Technical assistance - Nutrition in early childhood

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, under-five children, adolescents and pregnant women adopt optimal nutrition and caring practices at individual, householdand community levels, including in times of emergency.

description.narrative: Several planned activities were postponed due to the COVID-19 restriction including community level nutrition counselling activities; UNICEF supported the government with finalization of the national guidelines on maternal, infant, and young child feeding (MIYCF) and the supplementation protocol for the main micronutrient deficiencies. The updated code of breastmilk substitute was also finalised but pending the decree approval. Through UNICEF support. 3,663 community health workers were trained (68% of the target). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
